title: Skrillex Surprise Releases New Album: Listen
description: 100 gecs’ Dylan Brady, Sigur Rós’ Jónsi, and more are featured on F*ck U Skrillex You Think Ur Andy Warhol But Ur Not!! <3
author: Nina Corcoran
excerpt: 100 gecs’ Dylan Brady, Sigur Rós’ Jónsi, and more are featured on F*ck U Skrillex You Think Ur Andy Warhol But Ur Not!! <3
text: 100 gecs’ Dylan Brady, Sigur Rós’ Jónsi, and more are featured on F*ck U Skrillex You Think Ur Andy Warhol But Ur Not!! <3Skrillex (Photo by NAKEESHA)Skrillex has surprise released a new album titled F*ck U Skrillex You Think Ur Andy Warhol But Ur Not!! <3. The 34-song LP features dozens of collaborators and guest features, including Jónsi of Sigur Rós, Dylan Brady of 100 gecs, Boys Noize, and Varg2TM, among others. Listen to the album below.Back in 2023, Skrillex resurfaced unexpectedly with two new albums at once—Quest for Fire and Don’t Get Too Close—to showcase how his rattling bass juggernauts had evolved and his newfound grasp on dizzy emo-rap had tightened. He unexpectedly stepped up as a co-headliner at Coachella that year with Four Tet and Fred Again.., filling in after Frank Ocean dropped out.The following year, Skrillex won the Grammy Award for Best Dance/Electronic Recording for “Rumble” with Fred Again.. and Flowdan, and recorded “Talk to Me” with Four Tet, Champion, and Naisha. html:
100 gecs’ Dylan Brady, Sigur Rós’ Jónsi, and more are featured on F*ck U Skrillex You Think Ur Andy Warhol But Ur Not!! <3

Skrillex has surprise released a new album titled F*ck U Skrillex You Think Ur Andy Warhol But Ur Not!! <3. The 34-song LP features dozens of collaborators and guest features, including Jónsi of Sigur Rós, Dylan Brady of 100 gecs, Boys Noize, and Varg2TM, among others. Listen to the album below.

Back in 2023, Skrillex resurfaced unexpectedly with two new albums at once—Quest for Fire and Don’t Get Too Close—to showcase how his rattling bass juggernauts had evolved and his newfound grasp on dizzy emo-rap had tightened. He unexpectedly stepped up as a co-headliner at Coachella that year with Four Tet and Fred Again.., filling in after Frank Ocean dropped out.

The following year, Skrillex won the Grammy Award for Best Dance/Electronic Recording for “Rumble” with Fred Again.. and Flowdan, and recorded “Talk to Me” with Four Tet, Champion, and Naisha. Call it the result of steady work or the silent influence of working with Peter Gabriel.

Revisit Philip Sherburne’s column “Popping the Drop: A Timeline of How EDM’s Bubble Burst.”

F*ck U Skrillex You Think Ur Andy Warhol But Ur Not!! <3:
